My recent stay was unfortunately quite disappointing and fell significantly short of expectations, especially considering the price point. The core issues impacted the overall value proposition negatively: 1. Poor Cleanliness: The general level of cleanliness was unacceptable. Our room showed signs of inadequate cleaning upon arrival (dusty surfaces, stained bathroom tiles, uncleaned floor corners). Public areas like the lobby and hallways also didn't feel consistently well-maintained. This is a fundamental expectation for any hotel. 2. Slow Front Desk Service: Check-in and check-out were frustratingly slow. The reception desk seemed understaffed or inefficient, leading to long queues and unnecessary waiting times. Staff appeared overwhelmed, which impacted their responsiveness to basic requests. 3. Limited & Uninspiring Restaurant: The on-site restaurant lacked variety. The menu was very limited and repetitive, offering little choice day-to-day, especially for a stay of more than one or two nights. The quality was average at best, failing to compensate for the lack of options. Breakfast was particularly underwhelming. Overall Value: Given these significant shortcomings, the price charged felt unfair and did not represent good value for the service and experience provided. Paying a premium rate for poor cleanliness, slow service, and an unvaried dining experience is simply not justifiable.

We got a red hot room which included a lounge and free breakfast. It was pretty much a zonk stay, starting from the deserted Mangga Dua Square mall, which required a long rideto get there. Check-in was quick, but the room was a bit hot. After waiting 1-2 hours, it still wouldn't cool down, and even calling engineering wouldn't cool down. We waited 2 hours for a room change, but we finally got no response, and finally, after we threaten to change hotels and ask for a refund, then we moved to the new room. We were downgraded to a regular room, but that was fine, as long as it was cool. The lounge also had a problem with the AC, so we lounged in the heat. Our first room was an Executive Deluxe. It was spacious, with a sofa and a work desk. The interior is standard Novotel, it was pretty good, with a bathtub, carpeted floors, and clean rooms. There's a minibar in the area, perfect for those with kids who often do laundry. Welcome amenities were provided at the table: a fruit platter and a snack platter. Unfortunately, we didn't eat them because we were annoyed by the heat. The TV was small, not very big, but it was okay, as long as the room was spacious. The tea was Sosro, and the water was refillable. The bathroom was spacious, with a washbasin and a hand shower, and a bathtub. The bathroom was clean and modern, despite the hotel's age. It might be a challenge for older guests, as the shower was quite high. The amenities included Novotel's Deep Nature Spa, which smelled delicious. The second room was a standard deluxe room. It had a long sofa and a work desk. The sofa was so long that the desk couldn't be pushed back and used for work, but since we moved in late at night and didn't intend to work. The bed was comfortable and the room was cool. Facilities include a swimming pool, gym, and kids' club. The kids' club was basic and a bit cramped. The gym also has hot air conditioning, but the equipment is decent. The swimming pool is nice and spacious, but it's a bit dark at night. The evening cocktails include blueberry tart, red velvet cake, bruschetta, cassava cheese, tiramisu, salad, fruit salad, sushi, egg drop soup, fried noodles, and Singaporean fish sauce. Breakfast? Well, the variety is okay, with standard, basic flavors. Many of the dishes were either sold out or took a long time to be refilled, even though I arrived at 7 a.m. Menu: 1. Waffles, pancakes, porridge, egg station, sausages, yellow rice, potato sambal, fried vermicelli, omelet 2. Fried foods, Middle Eastern food, siomay, pao, corn, sweet potato, cereal, carrot cake, noodle station 3. Salad, cold cuts, fruit, juice, vegetables, curry chicken, potatoes, vegetables, fried fish 4. Bread, pastries, yogurt, milk, gluten-free, traditional snacks. My recent stay was unfortunately quite disappointing and fell significantly short of expectations, especially considering the price point. The core issues impacted the overall value proposition negatively: 1. Poor Cleanliness: The general level of cleanliness was unacceptable. Our room showed signs of inadequate cleaning upon arrival (dusty surfaces, stained bathroom tiles, uncleaned floor corners). Public areas like the lobby and hallways also didn't feel consistently well-maintained. This is a fundamental expectation for any hotel. 2. Slow Front Desk Service: Check-in and check-out were frustratingly slow. The reception desk seemed understaffed or inefficient, leading to long queues and unnecessary waiting times. Staff appeared overwhelmed, which impacted their responsiveness to basic requests. 3. Limited & Uninspiring Restaurant: The on-site restaurant lacked variety. The menu was very limited and repetitive, offering little choice day-to-day, especially for a stay of more than one or two nights. The quality was average at best, failing to compensate for the lack of options. Breakfast was particularly underwhelming. Overall Value: Given these significant shortcomings, the price charged felt unfair and did not represent good value for the service and experience provided. Paying a premium rate for poor cleanliness, slow service, and an unvaried dining experience is simply not justifiable.

Honestly I am very disapointed with Novotel Mangga Dua, actually Novotel is my prefered hotel everytime I go overseas. But after my stay at Novotel Mangga Dua, I will definetly change my perspective and move on to explore other hotels. I will also share with my family and friends not with stay with you guys if there are better choice. As a business traveler staying for four nights, I had previously booked this hotel through Agoda. Historically, whenever I visited Jakarta for work, I always chose Novotel Mangga Dua due to its pleasant ambiance and polite staff. However, during my recent visit last week, my experience at this hotel turned into a nightmare. I would like to outline the reasons for my disappointment in several points: The Surrounding: The adjacent shopping mall, Mangga Dua Square, was mostly deserted, likely due to the ongoing pandemic. Only about 10% of the stores were open, primarily selling clothing and IT products. Consequently, I faced difficulty finding dining options in the area. The Hotel: The lighting throughout the hotel was dim, and the air conditioning seemed almost nonexistent. The overall appearance and atmosphere of the hotel gave an impression of being rundown. The Hotel Restaurant (Level 5): On a positive note, the restaurant staff were professional and polite. This was the only redeeming aspect of my experience at the hotel. The Room: The room had a musty smell and inadequate lighting. The TV reception was poor, with no channel displaying clear images, rendering the large TV screen useless. The bed linens were in a deplorable condition, emanating a faint musty odor, and the pillows were excessively soft and thin, negating their purpose. Furthermore, the LED lights in the pantry area were also malfunctioning. Housekeeping: In my previous stays at Novotel, I must say that the housekeeping staff were always diligent and professional. However, this time, I was extremely disappointed as they did a subpar job. It appeared that they lacked proper training. Upon my return to the room, I noticed that the rubbish in the bin had not been cleared, the room service items from the previous night were still present, and the cups I used remained untouched in the basin. Honestly, this raised doubts about the cleanliness of the hotel and the reliability of the room service staff. Unauthorized Entry into the Room: Typically, before going to sleep, I always lock the door and latch the chain. On one occasion, while I was almost falling asleep, someone forcefully entered my room. Although I couldn't recall if I had locked the door, thankfully, the chain prevented the intruder from fully entering. I quickly got up, opened the door, and confronted the individual, only to discover it was a hotel staff member dressed in dark uniform. This incident raises significant concerns. Novotel, can you comprehend the seriousness of this situation? It could have been a robber or someone who intended harm, not only to me but also to other hotel guests. What if I hadn't been in the room at that time? Would the intruder have proceeded to steal my belongings or worse? This breach of personal space is a grave matter. As hotel guests, we are entitled to a sense of security and exclusivity. Novotel seems to have overlooked this crucial aspect. I believe no guest can tolerate such a mistake. To be honest, I am deeply disappointed with Novotel Mangga Dua. Previously, Novotel had been my preferred hotel whenever I traveled abroad. However, after my stay at Novotel Mangga Dua, my perspective has shifted, and I am determined to explore other hotel options. I will also share my negative experience with my family and friends, advising them against choosing your hotel when better alternatives are available.

Bahkan hostel menyediakan handuk besar dan kecil, tetapi di Novotel, mereka hanya menyediakan satu handuk mandi. Sungguh konyol. Lalu saya membeli banyak Yakult dan menyimpannya di kulkas. Ketika saya ingin meminumnya malam itu, saya menemukan tidak ada es sama sekali dan penuh jamur. Menjijikkan! Anda bisa melihat foto-foto saya. Kami tiba pukul 3 sore dan kamar belum siap. Mereka meminta maaf dan memberi kami voucher untuk minuman di bar (tanpa pilihan). Mereka memberi tahu kami bahwa hotel penuh, jadi mereka menawarkan peningkatan kamar gratis. Kami masuk: kami telah meminta tempat tidur king size dan menemukan tempat tidur double standar. Kamarnya kotor: noda di seprai, karpet, cermin, dinding, sandaran kepala... Ada serangga mati dan rambut dari tamu sebelumnya di kamar mandi. Kertas toilet tidak cukup. Saya telah melampirkan foto. Karena tidak ada apa pun di dekatnya, kami memutuskan untuk makan di restoran hotel. Hampir â‚¬16 untuk dua porsi pasta yang sangat kecil. Spageti menggumpal dan dipanaskan kembali. Makanan terburuk yang kami makan di Indonesia. Sarapan bisa ditingkatkan. Hotel kotor dan mahal. Tidak memenuhi standar. Ulasan bagus berasal dari penduduk lokal, yang membuat saya berpikir mereka memiliki standar kebersihan dan kenyamanan yang berbeda. Tempat tidurnya nyaman.

Hotel melakukan pemeriksaan keamanan, dan semua barang bawaan diperiksa dengan sinar-X. Kami melewati pemeriksaan keamanan, check-in, dan tiba di kamar, yang memakan waktu dua puluh menit. Kami menunggu di kamar untuk mengambil barang bawaan kami, yang tidak pernah diantar. Petugas yang menangani barang bawaan meninggalkannya di sana karena salah satu tas berisi pisau buah lokal dan tidak bisa dibawa ke lantai atas. Untuk hotel sekelas ini, kualitas layanannya perlu ditingkatkan. Namun, tempat tidurnya nyaman, kamarnya bersih, dan terdapat pusat perbelanjaan dan kedai tumis Teochew tepat di sebelah hotel, sehingga sangat nyaman untuk bersantap dan berbelanja.
